text: The women's singles event at the 2000 Summer Olympics as part of the tennis program was held at the Sydney Olympic Park Tennis Centre from 19 September till 28 September. Lindsay Davenport was the defending gold medalist in 1996. However, she withdrew during the second round on the competition due to injury. The title was won by Venus Williams, who defeated Elena Dementieva in the final 6–2, 6–4. The bronze medal was won by Monica Seles, who defeated Jelena Dokic in the bronze medal match 6–1, 6–4. ==Seeds== ==Competitors== {| class="wikitable sortable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" style="text-
